nodes.bodyText:
Seems EncryptedOrcInputFormat is the only inheritance of OrcInputFormat. So,
inputFormat.getClass().getSimpleName().equals("OrcInputFormat")
is equivalent to
inputFormat instance of OrcInputFormat && !(inputFormat instance of EncryptedOrcInputFormat))
right?
For EncryptedOrcInputFormat, given we are not using the open-source encryption, so we can ignore that and just use inputFormat instance of OrcInputFormat.

I am not entirely sure what exactly you are trying to infer.  Yes, following is correct.
inputFormat.getClass().getSimpleName().equals("OrcInputFormat")
is equivalent to
inputFormat instance of OrcInputFormat && !(inputFormat instance of EncryptedOrcInputFormat))
This check will ensure isSpittable to true for EncryptedOrcInputFormat.
Actually now I realize this change is bad. Its blindly assuming all extensions of FileInputFormat to be splittable, which may not be the case.
I am only going to extend the condition for RCFileInputFormat only.
